intro: Parnassia americana, commonly known as the American white fringed orchid, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Saxifragaceae and is characterized by its showy, white, star-shaped flowers with fringed petals. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wetlands. Its leaves are usually basal, with a smooth, waxy surface. Parnassia americana is often found in the eastern United States and is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
